post.body:

import errror no mudule named blender
What does that mean?
How can I fix this?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
What are you trying to do?

You have to start the script from within Blender. Doubleclicking the .py file in explorer doesn't work.

post.author: kat
post.body:
Quote:
o.k. I seem to be able to load .md5's in blender now
now a new problem.
how to attach model to bones skeleton?
and then how to call up texturemap?
any ideas?


Quoted your other topic above, there's no real need to start a separate topic on this when you can continue below.

post.author: kat
post.body:
You should really go look at some basic tutorials on how to use Blender as you'll get a better explaination then anything anyone can really supply you with here.

Surfice to say select the skeleton and then the mesh then hit Ctrl +P to parent the mesh to the rig. You need to get the mesh fully materialed and textured before doing this.
